instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4668: What is 820-4668? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no output audio
threads.message:
It has a volume icon in the system, at the time of raising or lowering the volume it is gray.

I tried with another system and it has the same symptom.

change <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and the same.

<SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> 4.45V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0_AUDIO_DIG_FILT</SIGNAL> 1.5V

i'm thinking it may be some of the amps

but the voltages on the coils when powering up and listening to the sound of the PRAM

L6401 6.0v
L6400 6.0v

L6410 6.0v
L6411 6.0V

L6500 6.1V
L6501 6.1V

L6510 6.1V
L6511 6.1V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_AUDIO_SPKRAMP</SIGNAL> 3.3v

<CHIP>U6400</CHIP>
<CHIP>U6410</CHIP>
<CHIP>U6500</CHIP>
<CHIP>U6510</CHIP>

<SIGNAL>CODEC_SCL</SIGNAL> 3.29v
<SIGNAL>CODEC_SDA</SIGNAL> 3.29v

<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_AUDIO_SPKRAMP</SIGNAL>
12V

<SIGNAL>SPKR_AMP_SD</SIGNAL> 00.2mv
<SIGNAL>SPKR_AMP_FAULT</SIGNAL> 3.13V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no output audio
threads.message:
Is the audio codec recognized in the System Information?
Any input/output device appears on the Sound section into System Prefferences?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no output audio
threads.message:
Yes.

Audio: Integrated microphone
integrated output

System preferences

Digital output - Digital optical output port

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no output audio
threads.message: Then the problem is on audio connector, or its board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no output audio
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no output audio
threads.message: I talk about headphones connector board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no output audio
threads.message:
I did that diagnosis, disconnect the audio jack, it often shorts. That's why I discarded that possibility but still.

You don't need to be connected for the audio to work, do you?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no output audio
threads.message:
The audio codec recognizes output device in base of conections made inside audio connector.
I don't have schematic of that audio board, to know what levels the codec expects.
Check on other iMac, if gets sound without that board connected...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no output audio
threads.message:
RESOLVED! I changed the audio jack and the sound came back, I removed the one that is in good condition and the audio goes away.

It means that it must be connected for the audio on the speakers to work.

Thank you [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]
